title: 112_hr2557
content: Establishment of a Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee. The Secretary of Health and Human Services shall establish the Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee to advise on interagency coordination, communication, and scientific viewpoints in addressing tick-borne diseases. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee advises on priorities related to Lyme and tick-borne diseases. The Secretary appoints non-government individuals as voting members, including representatives from the scientific community, tick-borne disease organizations, and healthcare providers. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee includes members who care for individuals with tick-borne diseases, patient representatives, state and local health department representatives, and ex officio members from federal agencies overseeing tick-borne disease activities. The Secretary ensures diversity in scientific perspectives among the members. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee includes members from various Federal agencies such as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the National Institutes of Health, and the Food and Drug Administration. The Secretary appoints the Assistant Secretary for Health as the co-chairperson, and members serve a 4-year term with vacancies filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee appoints members to fill vacancies for unexpired terms, serving until successors take office. Meetings are held publicly, with agendas set by members, and reports are submitted annually to the Secretary. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee functions include appointing members, holding public meetings, and submitting annual reports to the Secretary. Appropriations of $250,000 per fiscal year are authorized for the Committee's expenses and per diem costs, following the Federal Advisory Committee Act guidelines. Voting members cannot be permanent salaried employees.
